Articles.Content: I was wondering, anybody know a way to break the physics of the game? Just write a detailed discription of your procedure in the comments below. Thanks everybody for looking in to this.

Check some "Kraken Drive" threads - plenty of examples of game physics being ground into stardust. Or YouTube videos posted by Danny2462 - that guy loves baiting and trolling the Kraken, and made an art out of it

How about a video how to?  Look no further than Danny2462.

 

https://www.youtube.com/user/Danny2462/videos
Oh, I have looked into his videos already. They are hilarious right?

Just take it from me.... tweakscaled nosecone thoroughly clipped into the vessel does not make a fine, sturdy landing leg.

 

Also, got a challenge for you. Take the full largest Kerbodyne tank. Try to add wheels to it in such a configuration, that you can drive it off the runway without physics glitching.

Edited September 12, 2016 by Sharpy

14 hours ago, Alpha 360 said:

Just write a detailed discription of your procedure in the comments below.

Use the current incarnation of KSP wheels, sooner or later somthing screwey will happen.
Land on some landing legs, watch craft slide uphill.
Climb a ladder against an obstruction.
 

There are more, see kraken drive.
I thought this was a culinary thread

Kerbal-style Pancakes:

In a Rockomax-16 tank, combine LF and O.  Top with a Size-2 capsule.

Bake in a Skipper at 100% throttle for approximately 1 minute.

Serves 3 Kerbals.

Anything with wheels, landing legs clipped into something will cause crazy things to occur.  Also, if you tweak the .cfg and make the wheels never disable themselves due to part clipping, you can really have some fun (accidental most of the time but many vehicles i make with wheel clip disabled tend to flop around, fly, explode, and spagettify kerbals!
I've gotten some surprising phantom forces by combining a heatshield with a docking clamp.

In 1.0.5, I was trying to put a Mk 1 command pod inside of two containers, the Kerbal could still get out, but this caused "Baba Yaga". His head caused forces from beyond the grave to send the 3 parts soaring into the sky.
